timeline.bodyText: I checked a few methods in JDK, such as Pattern.matches. I think it's more intuitive to put pattern as first argument for this util method as well as like operator argument?
timeline.author: dai-chen

replies.bodyText: Good point! Will change the argument order in the util method to follow the JDK custom. As for the like operator, I think it would be better to keep consistent with the PPL specification, which is text like pattern.
replies.author: chloe-zh

replies.bodyText: I see. I wan't aware of that. Thanks!
replies.author: dai-chen

timeline.bodyText: Just did a quick look and found this method is very similar to others, ex. compareValue, equalPredicate and binaryPredicate. The equalPredicate method signature looks most generic. I'm curious is there any chance to only keep or reuse a most generic function generator method.
timeline.author: dai-chen

replies.bodyText: Yes that's also I'm considering, I will take a look into it
replies.author: chloe-zh

replies.bodyText: Used generic function bundles generating method binaryOperator in OperatorUtils, but some for special cases are remained and added java doc for them.
replies.author: chloe-zh

timeline.message: Change the matches method argument order
generified building methods for function bundles and function builders

Merge remote-tracking branch 'upstream/develop' into operator-like

# Conflicts:
#	core/src/main/java/com/amazon/opendistroforelasticsearch/sql/expression/DSL.java

timeline.bodyText:
could you seperate it from OperatorUtils in case is more focus on SQL regex to Java regex.
by define the ESCAPE is defined in SQL language, how do we support it?
is it possible to seperate the translation rule from translation logic.
for example,
TranslationRule.Buidler.put("//%", %").put("%", ".*").build()
Then, apply rule on the input REGEX.
timeline.author: penghuo

timeline.message: Separate matches method from operator utils
